text: when you're listening to a great piece
of music what are you imagining Mike
Hammett draws while listening as songs
and live performances play in this case
it's won by the band Phish he sketches
in one furious stream
lines circles and arrows all turn into
something like an impressionistic
flowchart but what he calls a schematic
this has been Ratliff for the New York
Times the process of doing this is
completely meditated for me and then
when I'm when I'm in the middle of doing
it no thoughts about the outside world
creep in in any way this is how it
started on July 31st 2013 if you'd been
at fish's concert in Lake Tahoe
you'd have seen the band play a version
of an open-ended song called tweezer for
36 minutes it went all over the place
fans almost immediately called it the
career highlight but Mike Hammett wasn't
there he was in West Hartford
Connecticut he was listening to the
concert stream out live from the
Internet and he started sketching what
he heard
I think it surprised everybody but it
kept going on and on and so I just kept
writing down what I heard and it ended
up having a sort of a interesting shape
to it interesting form and so I took a
picture of it and I tweeted it
you know people shared it and they they
felt like I think it captured some
essence of what happened and they were
able to look at it all in one big chunk
you know within a very short period of
time they began suggesting ones that
they would like to see in diagram form
which blew my mind because they also
suggested that they had no idea what
these things meant so began his ongoing
project resulting in over a hundred maps
in the year that followed he wants to
understand how fish and other
improvising groups build their great
performances this one was trying to go
for some different shapes he's not just
a casual music fan Mike Hammett has a
PhD in musicology and as a music
journalist for The Hartford Courant but
in his off hours he's feeling his way
toward a non-standard
and personal visualization of music that
describes its structure both on micro
and macro levels all the stuff you can't
put into words or represent on staff
paper when we visited him recently he
agreed to revisit that performance of
tweezer and diagram it again tweezer
begins in a typically he starts with the
progression of a songs basic keys and
scales so you're threading this way a to
G to see this this section here is you
know you'll hear a very distinct kind of
mood which I come to call bliss
when somebody like Traian says you does
an incredible lead guitar solo I'm
really not trying to represent that I'm
not trying to reproduce that in any way
you know because that's impossible
it's just a diagram of what I heard
happening at any given time
